[**Definition**]{} Suppose $U$ is an open set in ${\mathbb{R}}^n$ and
$T$ is a distribution $T\in {\mathcal{D}}'(U)$. Then we say that $T$
*vanishes* on an open set $V\subset U$, if the restriction of $T$ to $V$
is the zero distribution on $V$. In other words, $T$ vanishes on $V$, if
$T(v)=0$ for all $v\in C_0^\infty(V)$. (Here $C_0^\infty(V)$ is the set
of smooth function with compact support in $V$.) Similarly, we say that
two distributions $S,T\in {\mathcal{D}}'(U)$ are *equal*, or *coincide*
on $V$, if $S-T$ vanishes on $V$. We then write: $S=T$ on $V$.

[**Theorem**]{}[@folland; @hormander] Suppose $U$ is an open set in
${\mathbb{R}}^n$ and $\{U_i\}_{i\in I}$ is an open cover of $U$, i.e.,
$$U=\bigcup_{i\in I} U_i.$$ Here, $I$ is an arbitrary index set. If
$S,T$ are distributions on $U$, such that $S=T$ on each $U_i$, then
$S=T$ (on U).

[**Proof.**]{} Suppose $u\in {\mathcal{D}}(U)$. Our aim is to show that
$S(u)=T(u)$. First, we have ${\operatorname{supp}}u \subset K$ for some
compact $K\subset U$. that there exist a finite collection of $U_i$:s
from the open cover, say $U_1, \ldots, U_N$, such that
$K\subset \cup_{i=1}^N U_i$. By a smooth partition of unity, there are
smooth functions $\phi_1, \ldots, \phi_N: U\to {\mathbb{R}}$ such that

1.  $ {\operatorname{supp}}\phi_i \subset U_i$ for all $i$.

2.  $\phi_i(x) \in [0,1]$ for all $x\in U$ and all $i$,

3.  $\sum_{i=1}^N \phi_i(x) = 1$ for all $x\in K$.

From the first property, and from a property for the , it follows that
${\operatorname{supp}}\phi_i u \subset {\operatorname{supp}}\phi_i \cap {\operatorname{supp}}u \subset U_i$.
Therefore, for each $i$, $S(\phi_i u)=T(\phi_i u)$ since $S$ and $T$
conicide on $U_i$. Then $$\begin{aligned}
S(u) = \sum_{i=1}^N S(\phi_i u) = \sum_{i=1}^N T(\phi_i u) = T(u),\end{aligned}$$
and the theorem follows. $\Box$

[9]{} G.B. Folland, *Real Analysis: Modern Techniques and Their
Applications*, 2nd ed, John Wiley & Sons, Inc., 1999. W. Rudin,
*Functional Analysis*, McGraw-Hill Book Company, 1973. L. Hörmander,
*The Analysis of Linear Partial Differential Operators I, (Distribution
theory and Fourier Analysis)*, 2nd ed, Springer-Verlag, 1990.
